Raspberry Pi

18 Aug 2013

So I finally got a Raspberry Pi, I went with the model B of course. I also went a little crazy and got this as well from Adafruit.

1 ea. MCP3008 - 8-Channel 10-Bit ADC With SPI Interface
1 ea. ADS1015 12-Bit ADC - 4 Channel with Progrmmable Gain Amplifier
1 ea. SD/MicroSD Memory Card (4 GB SDHC)
1 ea. Raspberry Pi Model B 512MB RAM
1 ea. Adafruit Pi T-Cobbler Breakout Kit for Raspberry Pi
1 ea. Adafruit Pi Case- Enclosure for Raspberry Pi Model A or B
1 ea. HDMI Cable - 1 meter
1 ea. GPIO Ribbon Cable for Raspberry Pi
1 ea. 4-channel I2C-safe Bi-directional Logic Level Converter
1 ea. 8-channel Bi-directional Logic Level Converter
1 ea. Membrane LED Keypad + extras
1 ea. Membrane 3x4 Matrix Keypad + extras
1 ea. Monochrome 1.3" 128x64 OLED graphic display
2 ea. Breadboarding wire bundle
1 ea. Miniature WiFi (802.11b/g/n) Module: For Raspberry Pi and more
1 ea. 3.5mm Stereo to RCA (Composite Audio) Cable 6 feet
1 ea. RCA (Composite Video, Audio) Cable 6 feet
Not sure what I am going to do with it all yet. I think my main goal is to output some hardware data to the OLED screen. Maybe the CPU info and Chip Serial etc. And give it a menu...

This should be fun
